comments.creator: bas@quarantainenet.nl
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2 Iceweasel/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110906093027

Steps to reproduce:

.. failed trying to reproduce the problem.. will update description when successful.

(note: I automatically set a 15-minute alarm on every event I receive..)

- Person A creates recurring event (weekly, 10.00 - 11.00), and selects me as attendee
- I receive an event invitation and accept it.
  (VEVENT in email contains one recurring weekly event)

- Person A invites person B for a specific day (non-recurring, one time only)
- I receive an event update and accept it.
  (VEVENT in email contains one non-recurring event, but with RECURRENCE-ID and same
   UID as the original event invitation; I'm not sure what the standard prescribes, so I'll
   just report it.. :) )

- Person A deletes one non-recurring event (due to holiday)
- I receive an event cancel message and accept it.



Actual results:

After first message accept: everything ok; weekly event

After second message accept: not sure, unfortunately

After third message accept: only the event with person A and B is still there



Expected results:

After first message accept: everything ok; weekly event

After second message accept: not sure, unfortunately

After third message accept: weekly events, one event with A and B, one event canceled
comments.author: bas@quarantainenet.nl
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2 Iceweasel/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110906093027

Steps to reproduce:

.. failed trying to reproduce the problem.. will update description when successful.

(note: I automatically set a 15-minute alarm on every event I receive..)

- Person A creates recurring event (weekly, 10.00 - 11.00), and selects me as attendee
- I receive an event invitation and accept it.
  (VEVENT in email contains one recurring weekly event)

- Person A invites person B for a specific day (non-recurring, one time only)
- I receive an event update and accept it.
  (VEVENT in email contains one non-recurring event, but with RECURRENCE-ID and same
   UID as the original event invitation; I'm not sure what the standard prescribes, so I'll
   just report it.. :) )

- Person A deletes one non-recurring event (due to holiday)
- I receive an event cancel message and accept it.



Actual results:

After first message accept: everything ok; weekly event

After second message accept: not sure, unfortunately

After third message accept: only the event with person A and B is still there



Expected results:

After first message accept: everything ok; weekly event

After second message accept: not sure, unfortunately

After third message accept: weekly events, one event with A and B, one event canceled

Ok, found out what went wrong.. I forgot to accept the first event invitation.

Is there a way to detect this? "You're trying to update an event which is not in your calendar" or something like that..
comments.creator: bas@quarantainenet.nl

comments.text: Nope, we don't have something like that. Morphing this bug so it can get fixed some day.
